message.content:
cs.MM, cs.GR, cs.HC, cs.NI, cs.CV 

The paper discusses the representation, streaming, and quality assessment of VR content, which falls under the multimedia (cs.MM) and graphics (cs.GR) categories. Additionally, the focus on user adoption and immersive content suggests a human-computer interaction (cs.HC) aspect. The use of 360 VR content also implies a potential overlap with networking and internet architecture (cs.NI) for efficient streaming. Finally, the assessment of quality in VR content could involve computer vision (cs.CV) techniques.
